inn1.comm: Amla off straight away as he flicks a shortish ball off his hip for a single to deep square-leg
A quiet delivery turns into a hectic two. Smith pushes to Broad at mid on for a single but Broad throws down the stumps and the ball goes for an over-throw
good line just outside off and Smith defends to cover
outside off again and Smith turns it into the leg side
fuller and slightly wider of off stump and Smith drives to mid off
good start from Anderson, outside off again and Smith watches it carefully on to his bat as he pushes it out to point
lovely shot from Amla, stands tall and punches the ball between cover and point. The outfield is lightening-quick
Amla tries to repeat the shot but mistimes it slightly and it goes to cover
tighter line from Broad into Amla's body and he misses an attempted turn into the leg side
fuller and around off stump, Amla defends to cover
similar delivery, good length and Amla pushes back to the bowler
strange, Amla shapes to leave but the ball strikes him on the arm. Gentle appeal from Broad
Short ball which Smith easily pulls it away through mid wicket for four
shoved just down the leg side
straighter and Smith can only defend to mid on
on the legs again, Smith nurdles it down to fine leg and good running allows them to come back for a second
Smith advanced down at Anderson who sees him coming and pitches slightly shorter as Smith pushes to mid on
smith stays in his crease and a ball around off stump is defended down to mid off
decent end to the over from Anderson and Smith can't get a good length ball away
another lovely shot from Amla, Broad drifts on to leg stump and is clipped through square leg for four
short and cracked over point for four, not a great ball but dispatched with authority
slightly wider of off stump and Amla watches it pass him
better line and Amla can only defend towards cover
slightly fuller, Amla hanging back in his crease drives wristily into the off side
full ball turned into the leg side for a sharp single
better length from Anderson, much fuller and Amla plays to early on a drive and the ball goes to mid on
Amla wonders across his crease and flicks a fuller ball into the leg side.
England look a little chaotic here. Smith works a full ball  through the leg side and a misfield allows a third
short and wide, crashed to third man where Luke Wright's dive saves the boundary
pushed to cover
short and wide again, Amla with a flashing blade hit to third man for a single
Broad looks down on pace, on his comeback from injury. Amla opens the face and guides it away for a single to third man
huge appeal from Broad. Smith misses an attempted turn into the leg side and was struck in front. The ball pitched just outside leg stump so a good decision
Smith misses again and the ball falls into the leg side
Amla defends a better ball to the off side
good line and length from Broad and Amla punches towards cover
slightly shorter on off stump and Amla drives off the back foot into the cover region
better line, slightly wider of off stump and Smith drives to cover
too full and wide, Smith gets low down and drives through cover for four.
Smith advances at Anderson but can only hit the ball to the fielder
slightly shorter and Smith works it off his hip to mid wicket
down the track again and Smith drives airily, didn't quite time it and Pietersen saves the boundary chasing to deep cover
better end to the over from Anderson and Smith can't get it away
on a good length and pushed into the off side
slightly fuller and Amla mistimes a drive to point
shorter ball cut to deep backward point
Smith takes a ball from middle and leg to square leg for a single
fuller and the ball swings slightly away as Amla misses an airy drive
straighter delivery which Amla works into the leg side but can't beat the fielder
slightly wide of off stump and Smith runs it down to third man
full and wide and Smith butchers it down the ground for four.
defended off the back foot
slower ball, full again and Smith eases it down the ground for four. Great timing.
beautiful shot from Amla, fullish ball is timed through extra cover for a boundary
fumble at cover makes a sharp single into an easy one
Smith turns it into the leg side
shorter from Broad and Smith mistimes a pull shot
short and Smith powers it straight towards Morgan at deep square
Round the wicket, good length to the left-hander. Defended into space
propped forward and defended into the covers
good length again, tidy start
driven down the ground and they rotate the strike again
a bit of width and Amla has a slash. Loose stroke and Prior gathers with an "ooh"
flicked out to midwicket with a roll of the wrists, and that's the end of the over
good start, full length, shaping into middle and leg, pushed to mid-on
full again, and pushed into the gap
straying down the leg-side this time, tickled to square leg with no great power
a rip of the fingers down the seam, and Smith treats a well-directed offcutter with respect
driven firmly into the gap at cover. Mid-off runs round to field with a tumble
defended to mid-on, watchful and respectful
round the wicket, nudged to mid-on, another single
floated up outside off stump, Amla whips to midwicket but there's no power in the stroke
clipped out to deep midwicket, bread-and-butter single for Smith
tossed up again, and Amla is eyeing up the midwicket boundary. Slightly airborne clip this time, but it flies safe
fuller length, angling into the blockhole, and duly blocked
straighter, Smith steps across his stumps to work a single to square leg. Tidy but unthreatening over
on the pads, worked gently to square leg
offcutter once again, Amla hops into line to work the leg-side
forward and pushed to cover
back of a length, pushed with placement over power to deep cover
a bit of a long-hop, and some width as well, but Amla's not in the mood for chasing big runs right now. Another steer to cover
on the pads, worked square once again. South Africa are very happy to bide their time
full again, patted to midwicket and a quick call for one
driven firmly back to the bowler, who fields with a fumble in his followthrough
whipped with intent, but straight to midwicket
slow and spinning, outside off. Amla drives uppishly, and slices safely out to backward point
flicked urgently behind square
short and wide, and Amla has an ambitious flap, but can't make contact
driven, and driven supremely. Excellent timing, the fielder can't intercept, and that's South Africa's first boundary for five overs
pace off the ball once again, and flicked to square leg
clipped behind square on the leg side. Unfussy stuff
forward and finds the gap. Tidy but unthreatening from England
that's just revolting cricket. A short, leg-sided long-hop. Amla doesn't even feign interest, and nor does Prior, who lets the ball zip straight past him
pushed out to cover, better all round. And that's the end of the over
flicked to midwicket
flight, loop and a very full length. Smith defends back to the bowler
on the pads, worked to square leg again
outside off, Smith whips to square leg, runs another single, and appropriately enough, that brings up a 50-ball fifty.
Amla returns the strike
stretching forward, squirted behind square on the leg-side, and that brings us to a well-deserved drinks break
Sorry for the delayed updates, but I can tell you that Smith has gone, bowled by Wright for 54. SA are currently 109 for 1 after 19 overs
flicked into space
slightly slanting down the leg-side, and helped round the corner
tight from Collingwood, his offcutters are proving reasonably effective
driven into the covers
looped up, plopping onto a yorker length, and dug out to point
on the pads, tucked to square leg
back of a length, but arrow-straight. Amla hops inside the line and flicks to backward square

there's the breakthrough, and Smith will be furious with himself. A premeditated step to leg gave him room for a swipe through the covers, but Wright kept his nerve, zeroed in on the top of off, and a faint under-edge takes out the stump!
forward and worked off the hips
worked off the pads, down to deep square leg
wicket-to-wicket delivery, blocked on the line of off stump
in the slot, and de Villiers gets underneath a measured flick over midwicket. Two bounces and into the fence
pushed calmly to mid-on
good running turns an easy one into a well-judged two. Worked firmly to deep long-on
worked down to long-on, and that is Amla's half-century, his second in as many innings.
width outside off, and slashed down to third man
dabbed fine, down to third man, who scampers round to intercept
crashing cut, just a fraction too short, and that's a merciless stroke. Top timing
short again but straighter. De Villiers swishes into a pull, but doesn't quite time it
down the track with aggressive intent, but Wright pulls his length back and de Villiers adapts to dab the ball to point
full and straight to start his second spell
width, and wafted down to third man
outside off, steered to third man for another single
full and straight, punched into the covers, and they rush through for a single
down the track and de Villiers is very fortunate - an under-edged cut just eludes the leg stump
short and wide, and violently blatted through extra cover for an unstoppable boundary
wicket to wicket, defended with a perpendicular bat
driven on the bounce, and Wright sticks out a mitt to prevent a single
something resembling drama as Amla plops a defensive push in the air and just out of Wright's reach. The stumps are broken at the non-striker's end, but he's safely home
forward and defended
driven along the ground, all the way to deep cover
a tidy over to slow South Africa's momentum shift
Swann's return is greeted with a gentle drive down the ground for a single
slightly shorter and it's punched to long on
almost close there, as the drive back to the bowler is slightly airy
Amla just turns his wrists over the ball and guides it trough the leg side
prodded into the off side and the batsmen scamper through for one
slightly wider of off stump and Amla slashes through point where a diving interception saves two
punched to deep cover
short again, which at his pace makes no sense, and Amla swivels and pulls fine for four
full half volley on leg stump glided fine for four
better ball on off stump is pushed out into the off side for a single
slower ball defended out into the off side
pushed easily down to long off
filth from Swann. Dragged down and de Villiers had plenty of time to hammer a pull shot through mid wicket
gentle appeal as a better ball is pushed out into the off side
batsmen exchange singles as Amla turns it into the leg side for one
pushed down to long off, very easy here for South Africa
milked for one into the leg side
just waited and punched down to long on. England struggling to contain here, nine from the over
very gentle as a slow short ball is guided into the covers off the back foot
too short again, easily hit out to deep point
better length but it's driven easily past Trott for one
slow again and easy again for the batsman, steered into the off side
driven calmly into the covers for one
finished with a slower ball, which makes no difference it's pushed into space in the leg side
and that won't help, short and wide and pushed away square into the off side
lovely shot from De Villiers, skipped down the track and driven straight past the bowler where a diving Anderson saves four
better ball can only be defended
flicked into the leg side without alarm
blocked into the leg side
takes the ball from outside off stump through mid wicket with a flick of the wrists
good start from Bresnan blocked into the leg side
pushed down the ground
a wide slower ball is driven airily and mistimed, but with enough power to reach the boundary
good from Amla, walks across his stumps and works it towards deep square
mistimes a drive into the off side from a decent ball on off stump
better finish to an expensive return over, as Amla can only push a good length ball towards the covers
slower, and given a little more air and de Villiers misses an extravagant drive
worked away into the leg side again
delicate dab from Amla
driven down to long on and gives de Villiers his highest score against England. I suspect he'll get a few more from here
turned away into space
skips down the wicket and drills it hard to long on
shortish delivery is worked away off his hip into the leg side and quick running again allows two
a grunt from Bresnan as he delivered that, but still nothing in the delivery or the pitch and its worked away again into the leg side
de Villiers meets it on the full and drives down the ground
easily worked into space, very simple stuff here for South Africa
guided straight to the fielder at point off the back foot
de Villiers reaches fifty with a flick to mid wicket, he's barely broken sweat here but only took 39 balls to get to fifty
starts with a short ball which is guided into the leg side
with no fielders anywhere near the batsmen de Villiers drops it into the leg side for one

Well, out of nowhere England have a wicket. Short again and Amla gets a faint inside edge on a pull shot which is collected eagerly by Prior. Surprise for everyone that. Amla played well again today but will be disappointed not to go on.
and receives a short ball first up, which takes an age to reach him as he blocks with a full face out into the off side
calmly pushed into space on the off side
fuller ball that de Villiers watches on to the bat and guides down to third man. He looks in total control.
good ball on the stumps and de Villiers turns his hands over the delivery to collect an easy single
a bouncer which passes serenely over a ducking Duminy
good ball again pushed out into the off side
short again and Duminy hangs back and guides it behind square on the off side
good from de Villiers, waits and waits before dabbing into the off side for a single
Bresnan really trying to bang it in here. The pitch is unresponsive and Duminy again steers it to third man
Duminy just getting his eye in as he, once again, guides the ball away to third man
good ball is defended straight back to the bowler
turns it away to leg and good running allows two
intent shown as he advances and punches the ball out to cover
waits on a shortish ball and again works it into the leg side. The South Africans have worked the ball around very well today
attempted bouncer, very gentle and he'll have to bowl that again
tight line to finish and Duminy stands tall and drops the ball into the off side
pushed out to deep cover, easy run there
pushed back onto the stumps, and defended with a hop
short and aggressive, and Duminy turns turtle as the ball whistles over his lid
whisked off the pads, and down to fine leg
bouncer again, and Duminy has a swish. It's called wide,  but the intent is there
wide outside off, and keeps low as Duminy fishes with flat feet
defended with circumspection. A lively over
full length, slow and on middle stump. Nudged down the ground to long-on
wider outside off stump, but Duminy lets it go by
you have to say that was coming. Duminy had been trying to force the pace for several overs without success, and this time he hoisted a short ball straight down the throat of deep square leg.
forward and defended watchfully
sumptuous drive. A fraction overpitched, and that whistles all along the ground through the covers
on the pads, tickled round the corner
Bresnan continues to plug away on and around off stump, angling the ball in from wide of the crease
tidy again, and defended
an urgent single to midwicket, and thoughts of a second as the shy bobbles off the fielder backing up. But they decide to play it cool
good again from Bresnan, offering nothing to hit
turned off the pads to square leg
forward, and driven to mid-on
straining to the crease, tucked off the pads to square leg
another single as South Africa continue to bide their time before the big tee-off
full once again, and a sprawling Wright intercepts a checked drive in his followthrough
patted down to long-on, and they stroll through for a very languid single
on the pads, and turned to square leg
a touch shorter, and baseball-batted out to cow corner, where deep midwicket tidies up
big stride and driven to cover
pushed back onto the stumps, and driven to cover
slashed down to third man, where KP is waiting to tidy up
now that is a very excitable appeal indeed - Bresnan goes up three times in all - and you have to say, he had a case. Hawkeye suggests that was hitting middle, having rapped the knee-roll
after the excitement, Petersen escapes the strike
short to complete the over, and de Villiers completes it in style with a thrashing pull
dabbed to backward point
patted down to long-on
reverse-sweep, and delicately played.
tapped to midwicket
swished out to deep cover
looped up, and clipped along the ground to midwicket
and there's the shot in anger. Fantastic crash through the covers, a quick shimmy out of the crease to get to the pitch, and the bat did the rest
if he'd hit he was gone, surely! A pat to point, a suicidal attempt at a single, rightly turned down, and Collingwood's underarm shy fizzes just past the stumps
out to the covers, more calmly this time
whipped off the toes to midwicket
drilled uppishly into the covers, the sweeper jogs round to intercept
good delivery, saw the batsman advancing, and dropped his length accordingly
on the pads, turned to fine leg where Bresnan's shy forces Petersen to hurry
punched out to the covers.
cracked into the covers, but very well intercepted by Strauss
misdirected, and Wright pays the price, just helped off the hip through fine leg
down the wicket, a booming drive to mid-off
flicked off the pads, tidied up at deep square leg
outside off from round the wicket, that's Broad's standard tactic at this stage of an innings. And for that delivery at least, it worked
cheeky stroke, a ramped dab up and over the keeper! It looked at first like a top-edge, but no, that actually came off the face of the bat!
that is a sizzling stroke. Down on one knee, and absolutely lambasted through midwicket with a resounding click of willow. Fetch that!
no connection this time, but Prior can't gather an awkward bounce, and has to chase all the way to the fine leg rope
outside off, and no stroke even attempted. De Villiers presumably thought that would be wide, but it passed well within the tramlines
de Villiers steps across his stumps, and slaps a Broad full-toss through midwicket. A big over, and 350 could be on the cards here!
leg-stump full-toss, turned calmly to deep square leg
full length, clipped to midwicket
another quick single, Anderson rushes down the track in his followthrough, and his shy at the non-striker's end clips Petersen on the heel
thrashed through midwicket, and that is quite some hundred. Only 75 deliveries, and 10 fours. His fourth in ODIs, and emphatically not the last
three figures in the bag, and now he's really cutting loose. A majestic thrash through the covers, and he is middling absolutely everything
short this time, and hoisted through midwicket with an epic followthrough. England are reeling now!
low full toss, but angling towards the stumps. Played with respect into the covers
down the track to create a full toss, but short cover intercepts the drive
clipped to midwicket, and they hustle through for a single
driven hard once again, but straight to cover. Bresnan is applying the handbrake for the moment
right up to the blockhole and slips past leg stump as de Villiers swings across the line. Fine leg sweeps up
deflected out to point
a shimmy at the crease, ducking and diving like a boxer, and then striking with a stunning uppercut, a rifling cover drive. This is becoming quite some innings!
that's exquisite, down on one knee, twisting the blade, and helping the ball over his shoulder and through backward square
a rare dot ball, as de Villiers can't make contact outside off
dabbed to midwicket
and that, at last, is that. Another drive, but this time he got underneath the lofted stroke, and Jonathan Trott at extra cover settles the issue.
another dot, outside off. A chance to catch the breath
great delivery, genuine yorker, and dug out at the last second
not so great -  a low full-toss, but no damage done as cover tidies up
drilled to cover once again, and Bresnan is doing a fine job for England right now
up in the blockhole again, and worked into the covers
driven out to extra cover, full and fuller is the preferred length, and rightly so
this one pierces the field, and Bresnan's figures. Good stroke though, gauged the length early, and worked the gap
beautiful strike, on the pads, a low full toss, and there's no stopping that
bashed down the ground, and Collingwood tumbles dramatically in front of the sightscreen to limit the damage
up, up and away, and that's the first six of the innings! Straight back over Wright's head
drilled down the ground this time, the runs keep on coming
good delivery, and pounced on by Wright in his followthrough
down on one knee, and paddled with deceptive power, straight through the gap at fine leg
swished down the ground
driven into the covers from a good length
boshed out to deep cover, fielded on the bounce
bouncer, and Petersen top-edges this one into no-man's land at fine leg
another good yorker, dug out well, but this is a fine over in the circumstances
yorker length once more, and that is the end of an excellent spell in the circumstances. By some distance the pick of England's bowlers, in my opinion
A loose swish through the line, steepling top-edge, but plops safe at mid-off. Lucky
fetch that! A loose long-hop, and Boucher smeared it with aplomb through midwicket

well, that's a jammy dismissal! A horrible full-toss, Boucher takes on the midwicket boundary, but Wright - staring into the sun - clings onto a bullet-like chance, and England have a bonus breakthrough
short, and swatted through midwicket, and that is Petersen's fifty, from just 39 balls. His second in consecutive matches, and the 350 is up as well
dabbed to mid-off. One ball to come
and they won't beat that total! Broad serves up a yorker to rattle the stumps and wrap up the innings. A first-baller for Ryan McLaren, and a mountain to climb for England

inn2.comm: Good start from Steyn, swinging in and whistles past the off stump as Strauss shoulders arms
driven with intent off the back foot but straight to cover
late swing tucks Strauss up but he works it behind square on the leg side to get England's innings off
swing again, and Wright is off to a flyer... with an edge past second slip to the boundary
tight lines from Steyn and Wright blocks stiffly into the leg side
Steyn drifts on to the legs and is tucked away for a single to deep-square leg
and floats one up outside the off stump and is crashed through cover for for
better line from Parnell and Wright pushes it out to cover
bit of width but Wright mistimes his attempted cut and the ball trickles to point
shorter this time, Wright again attempts a cut but can't beat point
back of a length again and Wright guides it past point for a single
drifts too wide down the leg side and Strauss misses an attempted nurdle
on off stump and Strauss drops it on to the leg side for a quick single
flashing blade outside off stump, gets the outer half of the bat and good fielding from Parnell prevents two
short and quick, timed at over 94mph and Wright pulls towards square leg
drives powerfully to mid off
good length ball pushed out for a single
great shot, just timed it through the off side between point and cover
Strauss attempts a pull but the ball was too full and he misses
bit of width again outside off but Strauss can't beat the infield
too much width and this time Strauss doesn't miss out. Crashed through point
better shot this time, the ball was fuller and Strauss drives through the off side beating a diving cover
dances down the track and attempts a flay over cover, but the ball finds the edge and  sails over the slips to the third man boundary
shorter ball outside off stump and with a strong bottom-hand he completely mistimes it to mid on
Wright picks the slower ball and shoves it over long on for six! Good hit
down the wicket again, gives himself room and throws his hands at it, de Villiers' diving stop saved four. Good intent
fuller and Strauss is slightly too early on his drive to mid off
shorter this time from Steyn and Wright swivels on his pull shot and rolls his wrists to keep it down
Wright wonders towards the bowler and gives himself room but misses his slog through the off side
full and absolutely murdered to extra cover where Duminy saves a certain boundary and somehow keeps his fingers
one shot too many. Short and Wright tries for a maximum but can only top edge and is caught on the deep mid-wicket boundary. Bit of a shame, he gave England a decent start, but it won't be enough
Strauss aims through point again but finds the fielder
pulls a shortish ball from off stump to mid wicket
Trott guides his first ball into his favourite mid-wicket area
starts with a full ball outside off and Strauss drives airily towards point
beaten, extra bounce there as Strauss misses an attempted cut
and again, quick with some extra bounce, too close for Strauss to cut. Good start from Morkel
this time Strauss connects and collects two to deep point
fuller and driven to mid on, where Herschelle Gibbs who's on for Steyn does the fielding
lovely shot, bit too much width and Strauss eases it through extra cover for four. Strauss continues to look in excellent touch but England will need him to go on
Trott takes a ball from off stump through the on side
good follow up from Parnell and Trott watches it pass his off stump
fuller length and defended straight back to the bowler
Trott wonders across his stumps and works a ball from outside off to mid wicket
dragged down and pulled away through square leg for a boundary
fuller ball is worked again into the leg side and Trott keeps the strike
steers a good length delivery into the leg side
Strauss on the pull and steers it behind square on the leg side
full and Trott guides a straight ball into the leg side
driven firmly to mid off
short and, at 92mph, quick. Trott pulls carefully for a single to square leg

Morkel strikes! Full and wide and Strauss chased it but could only feather an edge through to Boucher. Strauss looked good but couldn't make a real impact. It's a trend that has gone on too long for his liking
Trott blocks into the leg side
again tries to work an off stump delivery through the leg side, playing around his front pad. Which is fine while he's in good form but may cause him trouble down the line
great catch! Trott tries to drive a full delivery through the off side with minimal foot movement and could only edge to Smith's left where his dive secured an excellent catch
Collingwood calmly watches his first ball pass wide of the off stump
Collingwood advances down the track at Parnell and hits it straight back to the bowler who hurls the ball back at the stumps, but hits Collingwood on the back of the leg
shorter this time and Collingwood stands tall and punches into the covers
outside off, and left alone
whoosh! Outside off, a wild swing, and no edge there
short, and turned off the hip to short square leg
driven to deep point, all along the ground. Even KP will be hard-pressed to rescue this game though
quick single, and through they rush
looking to dominate, KP advances, but has to defend in the end
Pietersen tests his newly repaired Achilles with another hurtled single. He makes it in good time
looking for the cut shot, but can't make contact
advancing again, but defended on the line of off stump
tight line and good pace keeps KP honest. This one is defended to mid-on
a big stride - several strides in fact - and urgently drilled into the covers
a swing and a miss, and no contact on that one
punched down the ground, but easily swept up. This innings is drowning already
leaping into line, and nearly a leading edge on that one. But safely negotiated
still biding his time ...
pushed back into the crease, and defended to midwicket
and another maiden for Morkel. This is not the scattergun of 2008, he's all tight lines and good pace, and England have nothing with which to respond
up on the toes, and wafted down to third man
advancing once again, and swished to deep midwicket. KP's timing is still proving elusive though
that's better timing, on the legs and helped easily through backward square
galloping down the track again, but once again the bowler responds and there's no room to work with
outside off, an uneasy prod, and through to the keeper
that'll cheer Pietersen up. An attractive drive, still not timed, but pierces the gap to perfection and has the legs to cross the rope
driven again, well intercepted at cover
a woolly attempt at a pull, no contact
second time lucky for Pietersen, short again and this time it is clattered with aplomb through midwicket.
standing taller now, and that's punched firmly back to the bowler
keeps the strike with an easy single
driven again, so straight it almost breaks the non-striker's stumps. Swept up by mid-on
defended
a bit of width, but no great power in the cut shot
punched down the ground to long-on
bouncer, and a good one. Pietersen thinks about a pull but takes evasive action
driven on the up, but straight to cover
full length, and threatening to swing. Good start
a controlled drive to mid-off
short, and pulled firmly and emphatically into the gap at square leg. He rarely misses those
that is some stunning timing there. Back of a length, and drilled into the gap at extra cover. Didn't look up to much, until it whistled across the rope
a fuller length, and that's better from Steyn
an inside-edge to keep the strike. And that's a handier over for England. More of that needed though
turned into the gap, some threat of turn
Collingwood returns the complement
drifting in from round the wicket, tidy line
solid defence on off stump
a touch of width, and greedily slashed to third man
tighter to complete the over, and though the hundred is up, England haven't got a whole lot to cheer right now
full length, and fast as well. Cut off the inside-edge, and into KP's pads
full length, angling in, and driven hard into the covers
turned off the face of the bat to midwicket
driven hard into the covers once again
pushed out to the deep. England content to deal in singles for now, as well they might. South Africa saved their big hits for the final 10 overs
whipped off the pads, and fielded with a tumble at fine leg
tweaked onto a good length, and defended on off stump
nudged off the pads to midwicket
down the leg side and that will help the cause
down the track but he can't cash in there. Clipped straight to midwicket
full length and defended
worked out to midwicket
play and miss outside off stump
slightly fuller and Collingwood flashes it through the covers
wide of off stump and Pietersen attempts an extravagant swish and misses
tighter line and Pietersen can only defend back to the bowler
good ball, yorker length and Pietersen jams his bat down in time
good intent from KP, wonders down the wicket and clips airily into space on the leg side
Collingwood skips down the track and clips to deep midwicket
Pietersen advances and attempts to smash over long on but mistimes it and the ball lands short of the fielder
Collingwood pushes out into space on the leg side
Pietersen attempts to smash through the off side but mistimes it
oh that's horrid. Shoved down the leg side and everyone misses it.
better line pushed gently into the off side
ooh, very close. Pietersen attempts to slash it through the off side, mistimes and the ball lands fractionally short of AB de Villiers
bit too short there from Duminy and Collingwood bunts it to long on
pushed with great respect into the leg side
swept from well outside off through square leg
Collingwood takes a couple of steps towards the bowler and steers it casually into the leg side
pushed, with the greatest respect, into the off side
Collingwood can't beat the fielder with his leg side nurdle to complete a good over from Duminy
Pietersen finally connects, moves across his stumps and sweeps handsomely for his first maximum
a single into the offside gives KP his 500th run against South Africa in ODI
Collingwood drives airily over cover for a single
a flashing blade is rewarded with nothing as the ball trickles out on the off side
this time a good ball on off stump is dabbed for a single on the off side
pushed gently out towards cover
an attempted mow is missed
Collingwood advances but cant connect as the bowler saw him coming
worked away into the leg side for a forgettable single
swept finely for a couple

oh dear. Pietersen wonders too far across his stumps and a dragged-down delivery comes off the bottom of his glove into leg stump. South Africa will be thrilled, Duminy has done a fine job building pressure and he was rewarded with the prize-wicket of Pietersen
bit short and down leg side and is nudged fine for four
Collingwood watches as the ball passes off stump with alarm
wide and skids past Collingwood's attempted cut shot
pushes into the off side
short ball, feeding Collingwood's strong pull shot but he hits it firmly to the fielder at deep mid-wicket
tight line and Morgan watches it carefully on to his bat
too short and Collingwood happily flays through cover for a couple
worked away to long on, not very pretty
big appeal from Boucher as Morgan misses a delicate nudge and is hit on the pad
good line from Duminy gently to the off side
Morgan stops on the shot and chips it towards long off, where Botha coming in swiftly completes a good catch. A tame end for Morgan but Duminy has done an excellent job
Pushed into the offside for an anonymous single
driven firmly to long off and Collingwood scampers back for two
misfield at cover allows the batsmen to cross for a single
pushed down the ground, not much happening here
short and Collingwood connects with his favourite mow over midwicket for six to complete his 50
Duminy continues with his good line and Prior can only defend back to him
eased gently into space
single out into the off side
cut away into the off side
prodded away for a single
Prior shapes up very early for a reverse-sweep and connects well enough to collect four down to third man
more conventional this time as  Prior drives through the covers
nudged, prodded and poked away for a single
another reverse shot, not quite a sweep but he collects one anyway
van der Merwe has the look of a man who nicks your lunch money at school, but his left-arm spin is altogether more gentle affair as that's pushed away into the off side
another single brings the total off the over to 10. So, if they keep that going for a while, we'll have a cracking match on our hands
dragged down, really short but Collingwood cramps himself and can't get it away
bit of turn there and poked away
drifts too wide of leg stump
turned away fine for four. Surprised everyone there, must have timed it better than expected
pushed away on the leg side
this time a conventional sweep finds deep mid-wicket
pushed down the ground for another single
well, that was good timing! Just leant on it and it flew to the extra cover boundary.
this time it's a more familiar nurdle into the off side from a good-length ball
drifts on to the legs, which allows Prior an easy guide to midwicket
a lot of shouting from the batsmen, but no run is taken as a good ball is defended to mid off
Collingwood advances, misses a leg-side heave and is struck in the unmentionables. Hilarity all round
fuller this time and comfortably worked away to deep mid-wicket
punched back to the bowler, who fields with a dive
nothing doing there, tidy line and length
attempts to carve through the covers, but under-edges into the crease
short, and pulled firmly, but without much power
wafted out to the deep, and for a part-time spinner, Duminy is doing a fine job
defended back down the track, another impressive over
good length on off stump and angling across the batsman. Defended
short, and shovelled out to deep midwicket
down the track, driven firmly, pounced on at short cover, and after all that excitement, it's a dot
short, no contact in the hook shot,  but not short enough to be called wide
pushed out to cover
decent over, and now the rate is pushing 10 an over
full and straight, and defended
back of a length, and defended out to deep point
width, and wafted. No contact there
good pace and bounce again, and no contact once again
flicked off the toes
yorker length, turned to midwicket
low full toss, but Collingwood can't cash in. A quick single to midwicket
driven into the covers
short, and that's Collingwood's stroke. Up, up and away, over midwicket for a maximum!
hello, that's another one, and suddenly there's a bit of spice to the Powerplay. Midwicket is peppered once again, and there's a bit of pressure for McLaren
full length, and defended in the blockhole
there goes another one! Belted through deep square leg, and that is quite an over for England in the circumstances
high, high, but not very handsome. Full length, right up to the bat, and the skipper himself is on hand to pouch the chance at cover as Prior attempts to launch one into the stands
yorker length, shovelled out to midwicket
a flat-footed waft, no contact and straight through to the keeper
an ambitious slash over the covers, nearly has the legs to reach the rope but is well dragged back by a slide towards the rope from de Villiers
that's misdirected, and a bonus run for England
outside off, chopped firmly into the ground
Gnasher has a fascinating stat about Collingwood's six-hitting. He's managed 64 in his career, and 16 in 2009 alone. Which is quite an aerial performance
no six on this occasion. Gnasher's gone for a lie-down after that stat-attack
worked out to square leg
cramped for room on the pads. They hustle through for a single
and that's the end of England's resistance. Collingwood went for his fourth six of the night, but couldn't get hold of it, and shovelled a simple chance to Amla at mid-on
yorker, and a good one too. Broad chops down, and inside-edges past his leg stump to get off the mark
thumped to midwicket
short, and swished out to deep backward square
that's a lovely ball for the situation. Full to tempt the drive, and zipping past the edge
worked into the gap, but singles are not enough now
slower ball, Bresnan has a wipe, Smith backpedals at mid-off, and that's the end of that
full length, driven down the ground
good delivery to finish, and Morkel's figures are looking mightily impressive
slower ball again,  but Broad sees that all the way, and thumps it over the covers. Top shot
flicked square

dropped, and that's a bit of a howler. A top-edged spiralling opportunity to Johan Botha at backward square. He clings on easily enough at first, but then drops it as he slides, and farcically tries to imply he had some measure of control. Umm ... not exactly
after that excitement, it's back to a more conventional single
that's a cracking delivery. If you can't rely on the fielders, do it with the ball instead. Full length, zipping off the seam, and detonating leg stump as Broad swishes through the line.
no chance to see the mongoose in action yet, as Swann keeps the strike
clubbed down the ground and here we go ...
hmmm ... that's not a mongoose after all. Scratch all of the above.
attempted slash through the covers, but no real contact
ambitious wipe across the line, again no real contact
short, struck sweetly enough out to deep cover
Swann is sporting a kind of beard that matches England for shabbiness, and he gently eases this ball to long on for a single
Anderson shapes to punch through the off side but misses
Parnell collects his fifth wicket to secure career-best figures of 5-48 as Anderson is given out lbw to a swinging full delivery.
